intro: Castilleja densiflora subsp. gracilis, commonly known as the slenderleaf Indian paintbrush, is a hemiparasitic flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its bright orange to red tubular flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has reduced leaves and relies on root connections to host plants for water and nutrients. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an important species in its native ecosystem.
